de.eckhartarnold.client

Class FullScreenLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.eckhartarnold.client.Layout
      • de.eckhartarnold.client.FullScreenLayout
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TiledLayout

    public class FullScreenLayout
extends Layout
    Implements a "full screen" layout for the slide show. In the full screen layout, the image panel covers the whole browser window (not the whole screen strictly speaking, because it is usually not possible to hide the border, title bar, menu etc. with javascript commands). The captions (if present) are laid over the image (the default position is the bottom of the image panel), while the control panel is hidden and pops up up only when the user moves the mouse. (The default position of the control panel is the upper right corner, but the control panel can be dragged to any other position by the user).
    Author:
    ecki

    • Constructor Detail

      • FullScreenLayout

        public FullScreenLayout(ImageCollectionInfo collection,
                java.lang.String configuration)
        Creates a new "full screen" layout.
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection of images
        configuration - the configuration string which indicates whether the slide show also shows captions and if a control panel pops up when the user moves the mouse.

      • FullScreenLayout

        public FullScreenLayout(ImageCollectionInfo collection)
        Creates a new "full screen" layout. The image caption will appear at the bottom of the image panel and a control panel will pop up when the user moves the mouse.
        Parameters:
        collection - the collection of images

    • Method Detail

      • getRootWidget

        public Widget getRootWidget()
        Description copied from class: Layout
        Returns the root widget of the layout. The widget can be inserted anywhere in a web site. After attaching the root widget to the web site, method issueResize should be called to make sure that the layout's size is adjusted properly.
        Specified by:
        getRootWidget in class Layout
        Returns:
        the root widget of the layout

      • issueResize

        public void issueResize()
        Description copied from class: Layout
        Calls the prepareResized and onResized methods of the widgets associated with this layout. This method should be called after attaching the layout's root widget to the DOM-tree!
        Overrides:
        issueResize in class Layout

      • initOverlayWidgets

        protected void initOverlayWidgets(ImageCollectionInfo info)
        Initializes the overlay objects. This method is meant to be overridden by descendant classes which do not really need overlay objects by an empty method.
        See Also:
        TiledLayout
